attributes.action: Create a Northern Ireland petitions website for the Northern Irish Assembly
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government has an online petition platform
https://petition.parliament.uk/

The Scotish Parliament has online petition platformhttp://www.parliament.scot/gettinginvolved/petitions/CreateAPetition.aspx

The Welsh Assembly has  online petition platform
http://www.assembly.wales/en/gethome/e-petitions/Pages/e-petitions.aspx

Why does Northern Ireland not have a voice? Why do we still need to send letters to our MPs to get our voice heard?
attributes.background: Unlike the Scotland Parliament, Wales Assembly and UK Government, Northern Ireland has no petitions website for the public to raise our concerns with Stormont and the Northern Ireland Assembly.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Northern Ireland Assembly is responsible for. 

If you'd like to send your petition to the Northern Ireland Assembly, you can find the contact details here:

http://www.niassembly.gov.uk/about-the-assembly/contact-us/
